intro: Sarcomelicope petiolaris, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sarcomelicope petiolaris is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii and is considered an endemic species.
